snippet: The government said in a decree that it would begin freeing up to 38,000 nonviolent offenders to make way for detainees including journalists, teachers, lawyers and judges....
abstract: Turkey plans to release tens of thousands of criminals convicted of nonviolent offenses to make room for journalists, teachers, lawyers and judges rounded up in wake of failed military coup; move reflects strains placed on state by Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan's purge of suspected government enemies.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

lead_paragraph: The government said in a decree that it would begin freeing up to 38,000 nonviolent offenders to make way for detainees including journalists, teachers, lawyers and judges.

headline.main: Turkey to Release Tens of Thousands of Prisoners to Make Room for Coup Suspects
headline.print_headline: Turkey to Free Tens of Thousands of Inmates to Make Room for Coup Suspects

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
